image.altText: A young man in a black face mask walks while surrounded by Indonesian police

items.synopsis: A 57-second video of a shocking assault kicked off a chain of events that ended the career of an Indonesian tax official and saw his 20-year-old son accused of beating a boy at the behest of his young girlfriend.

title.children: The scandal consuming Indonesia involves rich kids, a luxury Jeep and a shocking act of violence

image.altText: England bowler Stuart Broad shouts in joy as Australia batter David Warner throws his head back after getting out in the Ashes.

items.synopsis: Usman Khawaja scored his first century in England and Stuart Broad showed why he is one of the Ashes most deadly bowlers, despite a rare mistake. Here's five things you missed from overnight at Edgbaston.

title.children: Five things we learned as Khawaja gets a lucky break and Broad nabs two-in-two

image.altText: Usman Khawaja clenches both fists and yells in delight

items.synopsis: Not only did Usman Khawaja's Edgbaston century tick a massive box for his own career, it kept his team alive in the Ashes opener and handed his teammates a blueprint on how to approach the series.

title.children: Khawaja keeps Australia alive at Edgbaston, conquering his final career demon in the process

image.altText: A white man with light brown hair stands outside and holds his cat and looks lovingly at it.

items.synopsis: Home was an affirming place when Kai and Noah came out. They want the same in Australian schools, but educators say more training is needed to learn how.

title.children: Kai wants other trans kids to feel safe and included at school

image.altText: Four men involved in the search for Jennie Kehlet.

items.synopsis: As police dig up an abandoned mine shaft for clues that could shed light on the deaths of two people in WA's outback, locals conduct their own search as they try to help solve the baffling cold case mystery.

title.children: These blokes are using local outback know-how to try to solve a homicide

image.altText: Narelda Jacobs, wearing a denim jacket, poses for a photo holding her palm to the trunk of a paperbark tree

items.synopsis: With Australia's Voice referendum looming, I went back through the archives to learn more about the work my father did to bring us to this moment. But he was also ultra-conservative, and I didn't have to dig far to uncover his homophobia, writes Narelda Jacobs.

title.children: Digging in my father's groundbreaking legacy, I also uncovered uncomfortable truths

image.altText: Kylie Minogue sits on a red chair in a yard with dancers.

items.synopsis: Kylie Minogue's most dedicated fans have long been those in the queer community. Now, decades into her career, a new generation is discovering Australia's queen of pop on TikTok, and it couldn't have come at a better time.

title.children: Kylie Minogue has the song of the summer in America — and she threw out the old rulebook to get it there

image.altText: A black sign on a fence with white text that reads "Now hiring: Sign writer/installer, CNC operator, fabricator".

items.synopsis: With increasing signs the economy is already slowing sharply, and many economists now saying a recession is more likely than not, why is jobs growth so strong and unemployment falling, asks Michael Janda.

title.children: The jobs market is strong for now, but unemployment will be the last indicator of recession

image.altText: A woman standing on the seaside with an ice-cream in her hand

items.synopsis: Unmarried women in China are banned from using assisted reproductive technologies, but these women are taking matters into their own hands.

title.children: 'Don't tell anyone about it, ever': Why unmarried Chinese women are freezing their eggs overseas

image.altText: A mid-shot of a woman wearing spectacles and a pink and purple jumper smiles for a photo standing outside a house.

items.synopsis: Perth resident Stephanie Chu has called WA home for almost 20 years, but is ineligible to sign local petitions because she is a non-citizen. It is a situation that has left her and many others feeling powerless in their own community.

title.children: Stephanie owns her home and pays rates, but 'unfair' council rules have left her feeling voiceless

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin meets African leaders.

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin interrupts opening remarks by African leaders seeking to mediate in the Ukraine conflict to deliver a list of reasons he believed many of their proposals were misguided.

title.children: Vladimir Putin interrupts African leaders pushing for peace plan in Ukraine

image.altText: King Chales in red uniform with tall black fluffy hat covering his eyes as he sits on black horse.

items.synopsis: King Charles III rides on horseback to inspect soldiers in the Trooping the Colour parade, which has been held since 1760.

title.children: King Charles celebrates first Trooping the Colour parade as sovereign

items.synopsis: Nine men from Egypt, aged between 20 and 40 years old, were arrested, detained and charged on Friday, for people smuggling and participating in a criminal enterprise.

title.children: Death toll for Greek shipwreck rises to 500, as survivors reunite on mainland

image.altText: a helicopter flies above a village and giant rock face

items.synopsis: Relieved residents of a village in south-east Switzerland say a huge rock mass, which was feared would fall and destroy their homes, has come down but stopped just short of their settlement.

title.children: Rockfall narrowly misses Swiss village

image.altText: Composite image of Lauren Jackson, basketball and marijuana plants

items.synopsis: Lauren Jackson was granted an exemption to take medicinal cannabis when she made a fairytale comeback to basketball. But its use — both within and outside sport — remains stigmatised while Australia's laws are difficult to understand and navigate.

title.children: More Australians are using medicinal cannabis than ever before. Is it effective for pain, and is it legal to take?

image.altText: A composite image of armed police and a man on a Melbourne tram

items.synopsis: Police allege the 57-year-old man had earlier stole items from a CBD business before attempting to flee on the tram.

title.children: Police storm Melbourne CBD tram after man holds passenger at knifepoint

image.altText: Man in a blue suit with glasses reads speech

items.synopsis: Senator David Van has rejected the allegations, and in a letter to party officials accused the Liberals of disregarding due process.

title.children: David Van resigns from Liberal Party following allegations of inappropriate behaviour

image.altText: Usman Khawaja raises his hands and helmet in celebration of an Ashes century.

items.synopsis: Australia ends day two just 82 runs behind England's first innings score after Usman Khawaja scores his first Test century in England.

title.children: Usman Khawaja breaks English century drought, rescuing Australia in opening Ashes Test

image.altText: Two professional cyclists on bicycles talk amid a crowd of cyclists.

items.synopsis: The team made the announcement on Saturday, two days after Mäder's death during the final descent on stage five of the eight-day race.

title.children: Bahrain Victorious team, others withdraw from Tour de Suisse after Gino Mäder's death

image.altText: A coach and players of a Super Netball team hug and smile after a win in the team's final game.

items.synopsis: The Fever will have to defend their Super Netball crown via a knockout final after being stunned 65-62 by Collingwood in Launceston, as the Thunderbirds down the Swifts in Sydney.

title.children: Fever shocked in Magpies' last-ever Super Netball game after Thunderbirds down the Swifts

image.altText: An image of a sword hilt with intricate carvings

items.synopsis: The discovery of the sword, made more than 3,000 years ago, is causing excitement, with experts saying "the state of preservation is extraordinary".

title.children: Bronze Age sword so well preserved it 'almost still shines' unearthed in Germany

image.altText: Bwera General hospital

items.synopsis: Police say rebels from the Allied Democratic Forces carried out the raid, burning down a dormitory and abducting an unknown number or people.

title.children: Militants attack school in Uganda, killing at least 41, including 38 students

image.altText: A man walks while smoke rises above buildings after aerial bombardment

items.synopsis: The attack is one of the deadliest of the clashes in urban areas of Khartoum and elsewhere in Sudan between the military and a powerful paramilitary group known as the Rapid Support Forces.

title.children: Air strike kills at least 17 in Sudan's capital, including five children

image.altText: a composite image of footy players, people on surf boards and emergency personnel at a sporting field

items.synopsis: Moments before kick-off, a clash between the Kurri Kurri and Central Newcastle rugby league sides has been awash with sadness — a feeling mirrored across Australia as  people have paid tribute to the Greta bus crash victims.

title.children: Black armbands, minute's silence and paddle out for victims of Hunter Valley bus crash

image.altText: A friendly-looking older man in a business shirt and tie sits at a table, looking to the right of the frame.

items.synopsis: A fiercely independent savant, Triplett was the subject of a book, a documentary and countless medical journal articles.

title.children: Donald Triplett, the first person to be diagnosed with autism, dies at 89

image.altText: Police speak to a woman at a Maylands protest for and against drag queen story time.

items.synopsis: About 200 demonstrators drown out people protesting against a storytelling event hosted by a drag artist at a library in Perth.

title.children: Counter-protesters outnumber opponents of drag queen's book-reading event at Perth library

image.altText: Mungbeans in the dirty palm of a farmer's hand.

items.synopsis: Mung beans are one of the world's smallest vegetables. But there is a huge global market for this tiny — and valuable — crop.

title.children: Packing a gram-for-gram protein punch equal to a T-bone steak, demand for this tiny legume is booming

image.altText: The arrest of Joanne Warren at Huskisson in April 2020, and Joanne Warren outside the church today.

items.synopsis: A woman receives compensation from police after being wrongfully handcuffed and placed in a paddy wagon while walking by a protest to protect a heritage church on the NSW South Coast.

title.children: Woman 'thrown to the ground and arrested' by police at 'peaceful' church protest gets $60k payout

image.altText: Fox News chyron reading, "Wannabe dictator speaks at the White House after having his political rival arrested."

items.synopsis: Alex McCaskill, a longtime producer for former Fox News host Tucker Carlson is dropped by the network after being found responsible for an on-air headline that referred to US President Joe Biden as a "wannabe dictator".

title.children: Fox News ousts former Tucker Carlson producer over headline describing Biden as 'wannabe dictator'

image.altText: A group of men walk forward at a men's ceremony in Wadeye.

items.synopsis: Bruised and traumatised, resilient and proud — how the troubled outback community of Wadeye in the Northern Territory is trying to shed its violent past and move forward.

title.children: 'They all burned, all the houses': A bush town in anguish tries to heal from its violent past
